SentencesData.s0002: I have thought about it for two hours.
SentencesData.s0003: You have been sick since last week.
SentencesData.s0004: Since when have you been sick?
SentencesData.s0005: I have not been quite myself since the accident.
SentencesData.s0006: Kelly has had cats since I can remember.
SentencesData.s0009: I have just sold the last one.
SentencesData.s0012: Mom has just found out about it, and she is not pleased.
SentencesData.s0013: They have already won. Let's go home.
SentencesData.s0014: I have made a special dish just for you.
SentencesData.s0015: She hasn't finished her homework yet.
SentencesData.s0016: How many times have you been to Tokyo?
SentencesData.s0017: She has learned to speak Russian.
SentencesData.s0020: They have never eaten there before.
SentencesData.s0023: She hasn't found the time yet.
SentencesData.s0024: We have seen this movie ten times.
SentencesData.s0025: I don't believe we have met. My name is David.
SentencesData.s0026: Have you cleaned your room yet?
SentencesData.s0027: She has never been so surprised.
SentencesData.s0028: She has been there for a year
